summary: This script provides a detailed analysis of a series of scenes involving various political figures discussing significant global and national issues.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a news broadcast from Fox Business, focusing on the indictment of former President Donald Trump by the DOJ. The broadcast is presented by Maria Bartiromo, as indicated by the text "Maria Bartiromo's WALL STREET" at the bottom of the screen. The news ticker at the bottom reads "FORMER PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP INDICTED BY DOJ," with the time displayed as 6:01 PM CT. The broadcast includes split-screen images of various individuals, including a man in a suit with a red tie, a man in a suit with a blue tie, and a woman in a yellow blazer. The background of the news studio is blue, and the Fox Business logo is visible in the lower left corner. The broadcast also features a man in a suit with a black shirt and a small American flag pin on his lapel, standing in front of a blue background with the text "Vivek2024.com" visible. The atmosphere is professional and focused on delivering news updates. The video transitions between different individuals and backgrounds, maintaining a consistent focus on the news topic.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a female speaker introducing Vivek Ramaswami, a Republican presidential candidate, expressing pleasure in having him on. Vivek responds, thanking her and saying it's good to be back.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen interview on Fox Business, with a female anchor in a yellow blazer on the left and a male guest in a black suit on the right. The background behind the female anchor displays a blue-toned graphic with the word "WALL" partially visible, while the male guest's background shows a blue backdrop with the text "Vivek2024.com" in red. The news ticker at the bottom of the screen initially reads "FORMER PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP INDICTED BY DOJ" and later updates to "TRUMP INDICTMENT NEWS CAME ON SAME DAY OF REPORT THAT JOE BIDEN WAS PAID $5M BY BURISMA EXECUTIVE." The time displayed changes from "5:01P MT" to "4:01P PT" and finally to "7:01P ET." The male guest's name, "THOMAS HOENIG," appears in the lower right corner, along with a small image of him. The atmosphere is professional, with both individuals appearing engaged in the discussion. The video maintains a consistent visual style, focusing on the news topic and the interview format.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker announcing "Major developments," continuing to report on Donald Trump's second indictment, and alluding to Congress confirming the whistleblower account of Joe Biden accepting money for policy changes. The speaker's tone is neutral and informative.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a split-screen interview on Fox Business, featuring a woman in a yellow blazer and a man in a black suit with a small American flag pin, discussing the Trump indictment news and a report about Joe Biden. The background includes a blue backdrop with 'Vivek2024.com' and the Fox Business logo. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man, Vivek Ramaswamy, speaking directly to the camera against the same blue backdrop, with text overlays mentioning the Trump indictment and upcoming segments. The narrative continues with Ramaswamy discussing the Trump indictment, with text overlays updating viewers on the number of charges expected against Trump and upcoming segments. The video then shifts to a split-screen format, showing a man in a blue suit with a red tie speaking outdoors, surrounded by microphones, while Ramaswamy continues to speak on the right side. The text overlay reads 'WH CLAIMS NO ADVANCED NOTICE OF TRUMP INDICTMENT.' The scene transitions to Ramaswamy speaking directly to the camera, with a close-up of the man in the blue suit in the background. The video concludes with Ramaswamy discussing the Trump indictment, with text overlays indicating the time and upcoming segments, maintaining a consistent focus on the political discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker addresses Maria, claiming that "this is even bigger than just the disparity between Trump and Biden," and expressing his concern about the "two standards of justice" in the country, mentioning examples of BLM, Antifa, January 6th protesters, Julian Assange, Chelsea Manning, Joe Biden, and Donald Trump. He suggests that this is a "deeper abandonment of the rule of law" and highlights that the rule of law is "part of what it means to be an American." The speaker's tone is serious. There are no sounds of music or background ambiance.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen format on Fox Business, with a news anchor on the right and various images of former President Donald Trump on the left. The anchor, dressed in a black suit with a small American flag pin, discusses Trump's indictment, as indicated by the text "RAMASWAMY ON TRUMP INDICTMENT" displayed at the bottom. The background behind the anchor is blue, with the Fox Business logo and the website "4.com" visible. The left side of the screen shows Trump in different settings: outdoors with greenery, in front of a white building, descending an airplane staircase, walking down a red-carpeted hallway, and speaking at a podium with an American flag in the background. The time displayed on the screen changes throughout the video, indicating different timestamps. The bottom ticker reads "Maria Bartiromo's WALL STREET," and a promotional banner for "FRIDAY'S 7 PM ET" appears at one point. The video transitions to a new segment with a different anchor in a yellow blazer, discussing a political topic with the text "CRITICS SLAM BIDEN FOR CHARGING POLITICAL OPPONENT" displayed at the bottom. The background behind this anchor features a blue-toned graphic with the American flag motif. The video maintains a professional news broadcast atmosphere throughout, with a focus on political commentary and analysis.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker, identifying himself as a millennial running for the GOP nomination. He expresses disbelief at a president using the Justice Department to arrest a political rival and voices his desire to revive the essence of the country. His tone is serious and emphatic. He is followed by a female speaker who questions how he intends to restore the rule of law, acknowledging significant competition. Her tone is inquisitive and conversational.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a split-screen interview on Fox Business, featuring a woman in a yellow blazer and a man in a black suit with a small American flag pin. The background behind the woman shows a blue-toned cityscape, while the man's background displays a blue backdrop with the text "Vivek2024.com" in red. The news ticker at the bottom reads "CRITICS SLAM BIDEN FOR CHARGING POLITICAL OPPONENT," and the time is displayed as 5:03 PM MT. The scene transitions to a man in a dark suit and blue tie speaking at a podium with a blue backdrop featuring "Mike Pence 2024" and American flags, with the text "ANKENY, IA WEDNESDAY" in the top left corner. The news ticker updates to "3 MORE GOP CANDIDATES JOIN THE PRESIDENTIAL RACE," and the time changes to 4:03 PM PT. The next scene shows the same man in a crowd, with the text "AMERICA'S NEWSROOM WEDNESDAY" in the top left corner. The video then shifts to another man in a dark suit and red tie speaking at a podium with a red backdrop that reads "LEADER OR A CLOWN," with the text "FARGO, ND WEDNESDAY" in the top left corner. The news ticker remains the same, and the time updates to 7:03 PM ET. The scene transitions to a man in a dark suit and red tie speaking to an audience in Manchester, NH, with the text "MANCHESTER, NH TUESDAY" in the top left corner. The news ticker continues to display "3 MORE GOP CANDIDATES JOIN THE PRESIDENTIAL RACE," and the time changes to 6:03 PM CT. The video then returns to the split-screen interview, with the woman in the yellow blazer and the man in the black suit, and the news ticker updates to "COMING UP 9/11 FAMILIES SLAM PGA." The final scene shows the same split-screen interview, with the news ticker displaying "3 MORE GOP CANDIDATES JOIN THE PRESIDENTIAL RACE" and the time as 5:03 PM MT. The video concludes with the same split-screen interview, with the news ticker displaying "COMING UP 9/11 FAMILIES SLAM PGA" and the time as 5:03 PM
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker listing potential candidates for a campaign, then moves to a montage of political speeches, with male voices speaking in earnest tones about resolving issues, returning to conservative principles, focusing on economy and security, taking out Donald Trump, and beating Joe Biden. Subsequently, the female speaker returns, questioning a new candidate about the competition and justice system. This is followed by silence. The background includes serious and patriotic music accompanying the montage.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a split-screen interview on Fox Business, featuring a woman in a yellow blazer and a man in a black suit, both discussing the growing GOP field for the 2024 election. The background behind the woman is blue with a blurred office setting, while the man's background is a solid blue with the text "Vivek2024.com" in red. The lower third of the screen displays the Fox Business logo, the time "4:04 PT," and the headline "GROWING GOP FIELD TAKES SHAPE FOR 2024." The man speaks animatedly, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. The scene transitions to a graphic listing the 2024 GOP declared candidates, including Trump, Haley, DeSantis, Ramaswamy, Scott, Pence, Elder, Hutchinson, Johnson, Christie, and Burgum, with their names displayed below their photos. The time changes to "7:04 ET" in the lower third. The video then returns to the man in the black suit, now standing in front of a blue background with "Vivek2024.com" and "VIVEK 2024" logos. The lower third updates to "VIVEK RAMASWAMY (R) | PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE" and "GROWING GOP FIELD TAKES SHAPE FOR 2024," with the time now "7:04 ET." The man continues to speak, with the text "NEXT: STATE OF THE ECONOMY" appearing in the lower right corner. The video concludes with the man still speaking, the time changing to "6:04 PT," and the headline updating to "RAMASWAMY ON TAKING ON THE ADMINISTRATIVE STATE," while the "NEXT" segment remains visible.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a male speaker who emphasizes the role of an outsider in a race and criticizes the "corrupt administrative police state." He asserts that someone who is a product of the system cannot take on the said state. He continues to mention that a lot of professional politicians are in the race. The speaker acknowledges their service to the country, but claims that what's needed is "a chief executive in that White House."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a dark suit and black shirt, standing in front of a blue backdrop with the text "Vivek2024.com" and "VIVEK 2024" prominently displayed. He is speaking, likely addressing a topic related to political or business matters, as indicated by the "FOX BUSINESS" logo and the ticker at the bottom of the screen that reads "RAMASWAMY ON TAKING ON THE ADMINISTRATIVE STATE." The man appears to be engaged in a discussion or interview, as suggested by his gestures and facial expressions. The background and attire suggest a formal setting, possibly a political campaign or a business event. The video includes a lower third graphic that changes throughout, displaying different text and images, such as "FRIDAY'S 7 PM ET WALL STREET," "NEXT FED'S INFLATION FIGHT," and "COMING UP 9/11 FAMILIES SLAM PGA," indicating upcoming segments or topics to be covered. The man's demeanor and the professional setting convey a serious and focused atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker confidently asserting a belief that a party will become the one to repeatedly "put up the outsider in the White House," citing himself as an example. He explains his understanding of the Constitution and how it relates to firing employees. He argues that the administrative state is unconstitutional, vowing to "shut it down" and specifically targeting the FBI. He states that his way of governing is unique among politicians.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a black suit and black shirt, standing in front of a blue backdrop with the text "Vivek2024.com" and "VIVEK 2024" prominently displayed. He is speaking about "RAMASWAMY ON TAKING ON THE ADMINISTRATIVE STATE," as indicated by the text overlay on the screen. The Fox Business logo is visible in the bottom left corner, along with the time "7:09P ET." The man gestures with his hands as he speaks, emphasizing his points. The background remains consistent throughout the video, with the same blue backdrop and text. In the bottom right corner, a small inset shows a woman in a yellow blazer, with the text "COMING UP" and "TERRY STRADA" indicating an upcoming segment. The video maintains a professional and formal atmosphere, focusing on the man's discussion of the topic at hand.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker with a confident and assertive tone, emphasizing phrases like "self-made", "self-funded", and "hard earned". He discusses his campaign and funding, noting that he is not reliant on the "donor class" and mentions the significant amount of personal money invested along with support from smaller donors. No music or background sounds are present.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen interview on Fox Business, with a woman in a yellow blazer and a man in a black suit and shirt. The woman, seated on the left, listens attentively while the man, on the right, speaks animatedly, gesturing with his hands. The background behind the man displays the text "Vivek2024.com," indicating a political campaign. The lower third of the screen shows the text "RAMASWAMY ON TAKING ON THE ADMINISTRATIVE STATE," suggesting the topic of discussion. The man's name, "Vivek Ramaswamy," is displayed in the top right corner, and the time "5:05 PM MT" is shown in the bottom left. The video transitions to a close-up of the man, with the same background and text, and then to a close-up of the woman, with a different background featuring a blue-toned image of a building. The video concludes with a return to the split-screen format, with the woman on the left and the man on the right, and the text "CHINA: U.S. SPREADING RUMORS ABOUT CUBA SPY BASE" appearing at the bottom, indicating a shift in the discussion topic. The man's name and the time "4:05 PM PT" are displayed again, and the lower third now reads "STATE OF THE ECONOMY," suggesting a segment on economic issues.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features two speakers. A male speaker discusses how politicians are "beholden to other interests" that "restrict what they say" and "restrict what they do while in office". He expresses that their base needs "an actual outsider that will get that job done." Next, a female speaker addresses "this two-tiered system" and how it "has put America in a vulnerable position". Their tones sound serious and informational.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a news broadcast from Fox Business, focusing on the topic of China's alleged spread of rumors about a Cuban spy base. The broadcast includes a split-screen interview with two news anchors, one wearing a yellow blazer and the other in a black suit, set against a backdrop of news graphics and headlines. The main headline reads "CHINA: U.S. SPREADING RUMORS ABOUT CUBA SPY BASE," accompanied by a subheading "CHINA MENACE" and a red star symbol. The broadcast also displays various news tickers and graphics, including references to The Wall Street Journal, Politico, and CNN, discussing China's interest in spying on the U.S. from a Cuban base. The video transitions to footage of Chinese military personnel in uniform, marching in formation and saluting, with a large crowd in the background. The news ticker continues to emphasize the theme of China as a threat, with phrases like "RED THREAT RISING." The broadcast concludes with the anchor in the yellow blazer speaking directly to the camera, with a cityscape visible in the background, and a graphic indicating the next segment will feature Thomas Hoening discussing the "9/11 FAMILIES SLAM PCA." The overall atmosphere is serious and focused on geopolitical tensions.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker reporting on China accusing the United States of spreading rumors about a planned spy base in Cuba, with reactions from the White House and the Pentagon. She mentions Secretary of State Blinken heading to China and questions about President Biden’s response. The tone is serious and news-oriented. Following this report, the speaker transitions to asking the listener how their handling of China would be different if they were president.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a news broadcast on Fox Business, focusing on the geopolitical issue of China's potential spy base in Cuba. The broadcast begins with a split-screen showing a woman in a yellow blazer and a man in a black suit, both discussing the topic. The man, identified as Vivek Ramaswamy, is seen speaking against a blue background with the text "Vivek2024.com" and "Vivek" visible. The news ticker at the bottom of the screen reads "RPT: CUBA TO HOST CHINESE SPY BASE TARGETING U.S." and "CHINA MENACE," indicating the segment's focus on the perceived threat from China. The broadcast includes various images of a man in a suit, likely representing Chinese officials, in different settings such as speaking at a podium, waving, and sitting at a table with flags in the background. The ticker updates with phrases like "RED THREAT RISING" and "CHINA TO PAY CUBA BILLIONS FOR SPY FACILITY ON THE ISLAND," emphasizing the financial and strategic implications of the situation. The video concludes with a close-up of Vivek Ramaswamy, who continues to discuss the dangers of China-Cuba relations, with the ticker reiterating the financial aspect of the spy facility. The overall atmosphere is serious and focused on the geopolitical implications of the news being reported.
events_list.audio_caption: A single male speaker delivers a political commentary, emphasizing the need to reduce economic dependence on China and its potential impact on global relations. He speaks with a tone of conviction, addressing someone named Maria and proposing alternatives to current trade practices. The audio's focus is squarely on his message, creating a sense of direct engagement and urgency.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a split-screen interview on Fox Business, with a woman in a yellow blazer on the left and a man in a black suit on the right. The man, identified as Vivek Ramaswamy, is speaking passionately about U.S. businesses in China, as indicated by the text overlay "RAMASWAMY CALLS OUT U.S. BUSINESS IN CHINA" and "RED THREAT RISING." The background behind him displays "Vivek2024.com," suggesting a political campaign context. The woman listens attentively, her expression serious. The lower third of the screen shows the Fox Business logo, the time "5:08 PM MT," and a preview of the next segment featuring Thomas Hoening discussing Wall Street. As the video progresses, the man continues to speak, gesturing with his hands to emphasize his points. The text overlay changes to "CHINA MENACE," reinforcing the theme of the discussion. The background remains consistent, with the "Vivek2024.com" branding prominently displayed. The woman's attentive demeanor and the man's animated gestures create a dynamic and engaging interview atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker expressing that "we've been distracted by other foreign policy priorities" such as the "Ukraine war" and "Russia." He states that "the real threat is the CCP," advocating that we "wake up to that reality." A female speaker responds, agreeing and expressing that it's "amazing to me."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a news broadcast on Fox Business, with a split-screen format showing two individuals engaged in a discussion. On the left, a woman in a yellow blazer is seen gesturing as she speaks, while on the right, a man in a black suit with a small American flag pin on his lapel is also speaking. The background behind the man displays the text "Vivek2024.com," indicating a political campaign. The news ticker at the bottom of the screen reads "RAMASWAMY CALLS OUT U.S. BUSINESS IN CHINA," with a subheading "RED THREAT RISING" and a timestamp that changes throughout the video, indicating the passage of time. The broadcast includes a transition to a close-up of the man, who continues to speak, with the background and text remaining consistent. The video also features a split-screen image showing a formal event with individuals in military uniforms and suits, accompanied by the text "RAMASWAMY WARNS ABOUT RUSSIA-CHINA ALLIANCE" and "CHINA MENACE." The broadcast concludes with the woman in the yellow blazer and the man in the black suit continuing their discussion, with the news ticker and background elements remaining consistent.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female news anchor stating that Xi Jinping said that "we need to ensure that the world is is dependent on the Chinese supply chain so that we can turn it off whenever we need to." A male speaker, speaking with an assertive tone, asserts that "that is absolutely the point. They're exercising leverage", he adds, "much of this is part of their 500-year plan," and speaks about how the US thinks in two-year election cycles, while China thinks on the scale of history. He mentions bringing "a little more Churchill, a little less Chamberlain" to foreign policy, and emphasizes that "the top threat is the Russia-China alliance". He concludes by expressing a desire to disrupt this alliance, "a reverse maneuver of what Nixon did in 1972 with Mao".  The female news anchor acknowledges the point, and thanks the male speaker. She transitions to discussing a "big week for your money", and mentions two major inflation reports, followed by the Federal Reserve rate decision.
